This circle forms the first loop in the sketch. Draw another circle with center at (0.375, 0.375) and radius of 0.1406. This circle forms the second loop in the sketch. Note that both loops are closed and are on the same plane. Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.75. Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch with the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.0141 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0 - Sketch scale: 0.75 Part 2: Cylindrical Object with a Tapered Top Step 1: Create a new coordinate system Create a new coordinate system with euler angles (0, 0, 0) and translation vector (0.2203, 0.2203, 0.0141). Step 2: Draw a 2D sketch for the first face Create a new sketch on the XY plane of the coordinate system. Draw a circle with center at (0.1547, 0.1547) and radius of 0.1547. This circle forms the first loop in the sketch. Draw another circle with center at (0.1547, 0.1547) and radius of 0.1406. This circle forms the second loop in the sketch. Note that both loops are closed and are on the same plane. Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch using a scaling factor of 0.3094. Step 4: Extrude the 2D sketch to generate the 3D model Extrude the 2D sketch with the following parameters: - Extrude depth towards normal: 0.3984 - Extrude depth opposite normal: 0 - Sketch scale: 0.3094 - Boolean operation: JoinFeatureOperation The first part is a cylindrical object with a central hole of length 0.75, width 0.75, and height 0.0141. The second part is a cylindrical object with a tapered top of length 0.3094, width 0.3094, and height 0.3984. The parts will be joined together along their common faces using the JoinFeatureOperation to form the final cylindrical object with a tapered top.</description>
